suffixes.usage: attached to verb roots to indicate past action without specific time specification

suffixes.meaning: emphatic or marker of completed action
suffixes.usage: Marks present tense action, first person singular in announcement context
attached to nouns to indicate transitive relation with singular object
verbal suffix marking perfect aspect with emphasis
Suffix indicating completion or sequence

suffixes.meaning: to do something along the way
suffixes.usage: present process suffix, for transitive verbs only
examples: bibobainkin (going on receiving along the way)

suffixes.usage: compound suffix: -bain + -ai
Combined suffix marking action done progressively/along the way
Adverbial suffix indicating manner of action

suffixes.meaning: announcement of an action that will happen immediately after
suffixes.usage: tense marker; indicates immediate future; does not require -ra with first subject pronoun
attached to plural nouns to indicate transitive relation with plural object
verb suffix indicating completed past action
possessive-instrumental suffix combining possession and emphasis
verbal suffix expressing humility
emphatic suffix expressing uniqueness

suffixes.meaning: for verbs, doing as one goes; for nouns, plural
suffixes.usage: Verbal aspect marker for progressive action

suffixes.meaning: present participle ('-ing'), while doing so, happening right now
suffixes.usage: Marks an action in present continuous aspect
marks action that occurred days or weeks ago (definite past)
marks action that occurred days or weeks ago (indefinite past, does not require -ra)
postpositional suffix marking direction or emphasis
instrumental/comitative marker

suffixes.meaning: to do something as you go, present participle with simultaneous action
suffixes.usage: verb suffix describing simultaneous or continuous action, descriptive use, mostly transitive

noun suffix creating diminutive form
Verb nominalization or infinitive form
verbal suffix, intransitive
examples: jaskakaintaanara (having behaved like this along the way)

suffixes.meaning: one and only, actually, this one
suffixes.usage: nominal suffix indicating specificity or emphasis
adverbial/verbal suffix adding emphasis
attached to verb roots to indicate action that happened a few instants or minutes ago
attached to verbs to indicate past tense or form questions

suffixes.meaning: -ing verb ending (present participial); while doing so, simultaneous action
suffixes.usage: present process suffix, mostly for transitive verbs
examples: bibobainkin (going on receiving along the way)

suffixes.meaning: negation of adjectives or nouns; for verbs: to make an action happen, causative
suffixes.usage: attached to adjectives, nouns, and verbs; does not indicate tense and requires accompanying tense marker
examples: oinmabanon (will make see, with -banon announcement tense)
nashimabanon (will make bathe, with -banon announcement tense)

suffixes.meaning: transitive marker, the doctor is doing the making listen
suffixes.usage: adverbial/instrumental suffix indicating manner or means
examples: raikia rimonman (using lemongrass aroma that penetrated)

suffixes.usage: instrumental/comitative suffix
postposition-like suffix

suffixes.meaning: ancient past; event that happened a long time ago or any time in the past with added feeling of responsibility
suffixes.usage: marks action that occurred many years ago (indefinite past, does not require -ra)
examples: moatian rateni (I became shocked a long time ago)
kanoni (energies that became connected in the past)

suffixes.meaning: definite past tense - many years ago
suffixes.usage: marks action that occurred many years ago (definite past)

suffixes.meaning: using (usually with 3 syllabic words or more)
suffixes.usage: Instrumental case marker, variant of -man for longer words
announcement/future tense suffix for verbs

suffixes.meaning: will do something quite immediately, first or with priority
suffixes.usage: compound suffix: -pari + -banon

suffixes.meaning: first subject marker (required with definite past)
suffixes.usage: marks the first/primary subject in definite past tense constructions
examples: inin ayontaanara (having made it fully fragrant)

suffixes.usage: Suffix indicating completion
verbal suffix indicating excellent or skilled execution
compound suffix: -shaman + -ai
adverbial suffix indicating excellence or manner of action
Marks excellent execution with descriptive present aspect
diminutive suffix

suffixes.meaning: having done so, has been done
suffixes.usage: Perfect aspect marker, indicates completed action
examples: inin ayontaanara (having made it fully fragrant)

suffixes.usage: marks the base form of verbs
marks action that occurred hours ago (indefinite past, does not require -ra)
marks action that occurred hours ago (definite past)
command directed to a single person; widely used in icaros and day-to-day language; can be combined with -ma

suffixes.meaning: indefinite past tense - months/couple of years ago

suffixes.meaning: definite past tense - months/couple of years ago

suffixes.meaning: to do something fully or to completion
